population_specificity: Children aged 6-12 years with dental caries.
effective_dosage: 1.4% LSO toothpaste (1 min brushing once daily), 1.4% LSO gel (5 ml applied for 1 min daily), 0.8% LSO mouthwash (5 ml used daily).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the anti-ulcer activities of 21 bioactive compounds found in essential oils, focusing on their potential as new anti-ulcer agents.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that essential oils have wide-ranging pharmacological activities and biotechnological applications, with specific focus on their anti-ulcer properties. However, detailed results or statistical significance are not provided.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of bioactive compounds)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate DNA damage, cytokinetic defects, proliferative potential, and cell death caused by mouthrinses containing essential oils compared to other mouthrinses and a placebo.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in genotoxic effects or other variables between the essential oils mouthrinse and other groups before and after use. No significant differences were observed between any of the mouthrinse groups.
population_specificity: 80 Caucasian patients divided into four groups.
effective_dosage: 15 ml, twice a day, rinsing for 30 seconds.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of essential oils and other plant-derived compounds for anti-gout effects, focusing on xanthine oxidase inhibition, uricosuric action, and anti-inflammatory properties.
results_summary: Essential oils demonstrated dual anti-gout effects in animal studies, including reducing uric acid generation and exhibiting uricosuric action. However, human studies were rare, and further phytochemical investigations were recommended to identify active constituents.
population_specificity: Animal models and in vitro studies (human studies were rare and not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the immediate and sustained antibacterial activity of a mouthwash containing essential oils on undisturbed plaque-like biofilm over 7 hours.
results_summary: The essential oil mouthwash showed significant immediate antibacterial activity (1.18% bacterial vitality at 30 seconds) and sustained effectiveness (47.86% difference in bacterial vitality after 7 hours), outperforming 0.2% chlorhexidine under the same conditions.
population_specificity: 15 healthy volunteers
study_duration: Single application with follow-up measurements up to 7 hours

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review preclinical and clinical evidence on the mode of action and therapeutic benefits of 1,8-cineole, particularly its anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects in inflammatory airway diseases.
results_summary: The study found that 1,8-cineole has significant mucolytic, spasmolytic, anti-inflammatory, and antioxidant effects, with clinical efficacy in asthma and COPD. It acts as an anti-inflammatory modifier rather than just a mucolytic agent, showing promise for long-term therapy in preventing COPD exacerbations and improving asthma control.
population_specificity: Patients with inflammatory airway diseases (asthma and COPD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize advances in the chemistry, biological effects, and toxicity of S. grosvenorii, including its essential oils, over the past 30 years.
results_summary: Essential oils from S. grosvenorii exhibited various biological effects, including anti-tussive, anti-oxidant, immunomodulatory, and anti-microbial properties. The study noted that extracts and individual compounds from S. grosvenorii, including essential oils, were found to be basically non-toxic.
population_specificity: Not specified (literature review of existing research).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the effectiveness of essential oils and traditional plants as mosquito repellents and explore methods to enhance their efficacy.
results_summary: The study identified Eucalyptus spp., Ocimum spp., and Cymbopogon spp. as promising plant species for mosquito repellency. It highlighted challenges in quantifying repellency due to varying testing methodologies and suggested that formulation techniques like microencapsulation and synergists like vanillin could improve effectiveness.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on mosquito repellency testing).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of natural products, including essential oils, as alternative antifungal agents due to limitations in current antifungal drugs.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that essential oils and other natural products show potential antifungal activity, suggesting they could be viable candidates for developing new antifungal drugs. However, specific efficacy data for essential oils are not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on immunocompromised patients at risk of fungal infections).

study_goal: To assess the efficacy of aromatherapy as an intervention for people with dementia, focusing on behavioral and psychological symptoms.
results_summary: The review found mixed results, with one study showing significant reductions in agitation and behavioral symptoms, while another found no difference in these outcomes or quality of life. No significant adverse effects were reported compared to placebo.
population_specificity: People with dementia of any type and severity.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of essential oils as natural product-derived antimicrobials for topical applications in burn infections.
results_summary: The abstract mentions that essential oils have been studied among other natural product-derived antimicrobials, but no specific results or efficacy data are provided.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on burn wound infections).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the wound-healing potential of monoterpenes, a major component of essential oils, by analyzing preclinical studies.
results_summary: The review identified seven preclinical studies showing that monoterpenes and iridoid derivatives have promising wound-healing effects, with films being the most studied pharmaceutical form. The data suggest these compounds could be effective for chronic wound treatment, though research in this area is limited.
population_specificity: Preclinical studies (animal models or in vitro).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether high-purity lavender oil applied topically could reduce agitation and improve affect in nursing home residents with dementia.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference between lavender oil and the control oil in reducing physically agitated behaviors or improving affect in participants. The results suggest that lavender oil was not effective for this purpose in the tested population.
population_specificity: 64 nursing home residents with frequent physically agitated behaviors.
effective_dosage: 30% lavender oil applied dermally (specific amount not detailed).
study_duration: Single application with observations for 60 minutes post-exposure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effects of Listerine (an essential oil compound) and chlorhexidine on the morphology and proliferation of stem cells derived from the buccal fat pad.
results_summary: The study found that both CHX and LIS reduced cell viability when applied to titanium discs, even at short exposure times (30 sec). No significant alterations in cytoskeletal organization were observed, but cytotoxicity was evident.
population_specificity: Stem cells derived from the buccal fat pad.
effective_dosage: Immersion in CHX or LIS for 30 sec, 1.5 min, or 4.5 min.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of fragrance substances, including those found in essential oils, to form potent allergens through abiotic and biotic activation, increasing sensitization risk.
results_summary: The study found that commonly used fragrance substances in essential oils can autoxidize, forming potent sensitizers linked to contact allergies. Some substances act as prohaptens, activating in the skin, with clinical studies confirming these experimental findings.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of fragrance substances, including essential oils)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the antiviral potential of germacrone, a component of essential oils from Rhizoma Curcuma, against influenza viruses, both alone and in combination with oseltamivir.
results_summary: Germacrone inhibited replication of H1N1, H3N2, and influenza B viruses in a dose-dependent manner, reduced viral protein expression and RNA synthesis, and protected mice from lethal infection. Combining germacrone with oseltamivir showed additive antiviral effects in vitro and in vivo.
population_specificity: MDCK and A549 cells, and mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically evaluate and classify evidence on contact allergy to fragrances, including essential oils, to inform prevention strategies.
results_summary: The study identified 54 individual chemicals and 28 natural extracts (essential oils) as established contact allergens in humans, with 12 chemicals of special concern due to high reported cases of contact allergy. It recommended disclosure of 127 substances due to skin sensitizing properties and limiting concentrations of 11 high-risk substances.
population_specificity: Patients patch tested for suspected allergic contact dermatitis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the clinical effectiveness and cost-effectiveness of essential oils and aromatherapy for treating acne.
results_summary: The study is a randomized, wait-list controlled trial designed to assess changes in physical and psychosocial symptoms of acne using standardized instruments, but results are not yet available as the study is ongoing.
population_specificity: 192 participants aged 16-45 years with acne vulgaris, recruited primarily through educational campuses in Adelaide, South Australia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential anti-dengue activities of essential oils and other plant-based compounds, focusing on their efficacy against Flavivirus.
results_summary: The study identified 31 plant species with anti-dengue activity, including crude extracts and essential oils, showing broad activity against Flavivirus. Ten isolated phytochemicals demonstrated potential for dengue treatment development.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the structural categories and molecular anticancer mechanisms of essential oil constituents from aromatic herbs and dietary plants.
results_summary: The study found that essential oil constituents exhibit chemopreventive properties through mechanisms such as antioxidant, antimutagenic, antiproliferative effects, immune enhancement, enzyme induction, detoxification, and modulation of multidrug resistance. The review highlights the potential of these constituents in cancer prevention and treatment.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of literature)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effectiveness of aromatherapy using essential oils for alleviating psychiatric disorders and to propose potential molecular mechanisms underlying its therapeutic effects.
results_summary: The study found that essential oils like lavender, lemon, and bergamot can help relieve stress, anxiety, and depression by stimulating the olfactory system and influencing neurotransmitter activity, though the precise molecular mechanisms remain unclear.
population_specificity: Individuals with psychiatric disorders (e.g., stress, anxiety, depression).

study_goal: To compare the plaque and gingivitis inhibiting effect of Listerine(®) Total Care (essential oil-based mouthwash) against negative (22% hydro-alcohol solution) and positive (0.2% chlorhexidine) controls in an experimental gingivitis model.
results_summary: After 21 days, chlorhexidine showed significantly lower plaque and gingivitis scores than Listerine(®) and the alcohol control, with little difference between the latter two. Listerine(®) Total Care had no statistically significant effect on plaque formation compared to its vehicle control.
population_specificity: 45 healthy volunteers (15 per group)
effective_dosage: Not specified (commercially available Listerine(®) Total Care used as test product)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of essential oils as safe and effective alternatives for preventing and treating periodontal diseases caused by antibiotic-resistant bacteria.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that essential oils may be effective against periodontal pathogens, justifying their use as natural alternatives, but specific efficacy results are not detailed. The study reviews existing research on essential oils' impact on periodontal bacteria.
population_specificity: Moroccan adolescents with aggressive periodontitis and virulent periodontal bacteria.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antifungal activity of essential oils against Microsporum canis in vitro and in vivo, and assess their potential for treating feline microsporiasis.
results_summary: Thymus serpillum and Origanum vulgare showed the strongest antifungal activity, and a mixture of these oils enhanced efficacy. Four out of seven treated cats recovered clinically and culturally.
population_specificity: Feline isolates of Microsporum canis and seven infected, symptomatic cats.
effective_dosage: A mixture of 5% O. vulgare, 5% R. officinalis, and 2% T. serpillum in sweet almond oil.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to confirm the efficacy of Myrtol® (a phytomedicine derived from essential oils) in treating acute bronchitis compared to placebo.
results_summary: Myrtol® showed statistically significant superiority over placebo, with a 62.1% reduction in coughing fits compared to 49.8% for placebo, shorter median time to symptom improvement, and fewer sleep disturbances due to coughing. Both treatments were generally well tolerated.
population_specificity: Patients with acute bronchitis and without confounding co-morbidity or co-medication.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the physical and psychological effects of inhalation aromatherapy using essential oils high in linalool and linalyl acetate on pregnant women.
results_summary: The study found that aromatherapy significantly improved Tension-Anxiety and Anger-Hostility scores in pregnant women and increased parasympathetic nerve activity, though no substantial differences were observed between the aromatherapy and control groups.
population_specificity: Pregnant women in week 28 of a single pregnancy with a normal course.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of antiseptic mouth rinses, including essential oils, in controlling plaque and gingivitis, and assess associated risks.
results_summary: Essential oils combined with methyl salicylate showed clinically significant anti-gingivitis and anti-plaque benefits, with no significant safety concerns reported. Limited data were available on effects on dental restorations.
population_specificity: General population using antiseptic mouth rinses for oral health.
effective_dosage: Not specified (menthol, thymol, and eucalyptol in combination).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anti-inflammatory potential of 32 bioactive monoterpenes found in essential oils.
results_summary: The study found that the monoterpenes in essential oils exhibit pharmacological potential as anti-inflammatory agents, suggesting their viability for therapeutic use.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing data on monoterpenes).

study_goal: To assess the short-term effect of essential-oils mouthwash on bacterial levels in saliva and gingival plaque in Chinese adults with chronic periodontitis compared to scaling and root planing (SRP).
results_summary: Essential-oils mouthwash reduced Fn levels in supragingival plaque by 53.2% and total bacterial loads in plaque, but was less effective than SRP in reducing Pg and Pi in subgingival plaque. No significant bacterial reduction was observed in periodontally healthy subjects.
population_specificity: Chinese adults with chronic periodontitis (50) and periodontally healthy adults (22).
effective_dosage: 7-day essential-oils mouthwash regimen (specific dosage not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review plants and their active constituents, including essential oils, for their potential cognitive-enhancing and antidementia effects.
results_summary: The study identified essential oils among bioactive compounds with cholinesterase inhibitory, anti-inflammatory, or antioxidant activities, suggesting potential benefits for neurodegenerative disorders like Alzheimer's disease. However, specific efficacy data on essential oils were not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of plant-based treatments for cognitive disorders)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of a combination herbal drop (Lamigex) containing essential oils to ciprofloxacin 0.3% in alleviating acute external otitis symptoms.
results_summary: Lamigex showed comparable efficacy to ciprofloxacin in improving AEO symptoms, reducing pain, and decreasing microbial cultures, with no significant differences between the two treatments.
population_specificity: 70 patients with acute external otitis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the antiplaque/antigingivitis efficacy of an essential oil-containing mouthrinse (EO) to a 0.075% cetylpyridinium chloride mouthrinse (CPC) using a two-week experimental gingivitis model.
results_summary: The EO rinse showed statistically significant reductions in plaque (36.5%), gingivitis (17.5%), and bleeding sites (43.2%) compared to the negative control, and outperformed the CPC rinse with reductions of 27.7%, 11.9%, and 30.0%, respectively.
population_specificity: 185 subjects (182 completed) in a randomized, examiner-blind, parallel, controlled clinical study.
effective_dosage: 20 ml of assigned rinse for 30 seconds twice daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of a mixture of essential oils (peppermint, basil, and helichrysum) on reducing mental exhaustion or moderate burnout using a personal inhaler.
results_summary: Both groups experienced a reduction in perceived mental exhaustion/burnout, but the aromatherapy group showed a much greater reduction. The results suggest inhaling essential oils may help reduce perceived mental fatigue/burnout.
population_specificity: 13 women and 1 man with self-assessed mental exhaustion/moderate burnout.
effective_dosage: Not specified (personal inhaler used as needed).
study_duration: 1 week of intervention (after 1 week baseline and followed by 1 week washout).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify and report the presence of essential oils in the genus Craniotome and their traditional use in wound treatment.
results_summary: The study isolated essential oils from Craniotome furcata, along with other compounds, but did not evaluate their specific effects or efficacy in wound treatment.
population_specificity: Not specified (traditional use implies general application).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential synergistic effects of essential oils, tocotrienols, and statins in suppressing osteoclastogenesis and promoting osteoblastogenesis for bone health.
results_summary: The study found that essential oils, along with tocotrienols and statins, may synergistically inhibit osteoclast differentiation and promote osteoblast activity, resembling the effects of statins. In vivo studies confirmed bone-protective effects of tocotrienols at nontoxic doses.
population_specificity: Animal models (specific species not mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the experimental activity of essential oils in gastric ulcer prevention and treatment, focusing on their mechanisms of gastroprotection and ulcer healing.
results_summary: The abstract indicates that essential oils have been successfully used for gastroprotection and ulcer healing, with a review of their traditional use, bioassays, and mechanisms of action. The study suggests potential benefits but does not provide specific efficacy data.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antiplaque and antigingivitis potential of an alcohol-free essential oils mouthrinse compared to a hydroalcohol control in a 2-week experimental gingivitis model.
results_summary: The alcohol-free essential oils mouthrinse (Listerine Zero) was significantly more effective than the control in reducing plaque (23.9%) and gingivitis (10.4%) after 2 weeks of use.
population_specificity: 92 subjects (male and female), aged 18-68 years, in good general health.
effective_dosage: Twice daily rinsing (specific volume not stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of flavonoids, including those from essential oils, in promoting bone health beyond calcium and vitamin D.
results_summary: The study suggests flavonoids, including those from essential oils, may enhance bone formation and inhibit bone resorption by influencing osteoblast and osteoclast differentiation, but further research is needed to identify the most effective flavonoids and optimal dosages.
population_specificity: Not specified (general association with dietary flavonoid consumption)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of essential oils as safe and effective antiviral agents against viral hemorrhagic fevers.
results_summary: The abstract mentions that essential oils are among the natural sources being investigated for antiviral properties, but no specific results regarding their efficacy are provided. The study highlights the need for broader antiviral options but does not detail findings on essential oils.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on viral hemorrhagic fevers).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compile scientific evidence on the effects of essential oils administered via inhalation for alleviating nausea and vomiting.
results_summary: The study found that inhaled peppermint or ginger essential oils reduced nausea and vomiting incidence and severity, decreased antiemetic use, and improved patient satisfaction, but methodological flaws and limited research prevented definitive conclusions.
population_specificity: Various conditions regardless of age group (specific populations not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of essential oils, particularly tea tree oil and its main compound terpinen-4-ol, in treating bacteria-related inflammation, with a focus on mastitis.
results_summary: The study found that essential oils, including tea tree oil, exhibit significant antibacterial, antifungal, and anti-inflammatory effects by modulating cytokine expression, potentially offering a biotherapy alternative to synthetic antibiotics for mastitis.
population_specificity: Mammalian responses to bacteria-related inflammation (specific population not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the chemical, pharmacological, and toxicological investigations of Orthosiphon stamineus, including its essential oils, and evaluate its traditional and therapeutic uses.
results_summary: The study found that Orthosiphon stamineus exhibits multiple pharmacological activities, including antimicrobial effects, attributed to its phytochemical content, such as essential oils. The plant's traditional uses are supported by various in vitro and in vivo models.
population_specificity: Not specified (general pharmacological and toxicological review).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent patents on the potential uses of essential oils in human health and disease treatment.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that essential oils exhibit antibacterial, antiviral, antifungal, and other therapeutic properties, with applications in treating infections, cancer, cardiovascular and nervous system disorders, and gynecological diseases. They are also used in food and cosmetic industries.
population_specificity: Not specified (general human health applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize and analyze the anti-cancer properties of terpenoids in Rhizoma Curcumae essential oils to facilitate new anti-cancer drug development.
results_summary: The study found that terpenoids like β-elemene, δ-elemene, furanodiene, furanodienone, curcumol, and germacrone exhibit anti-cancer effects by inducing apoptosis, inhibiting metastasis, and retarding cell cycle arrest, though most evidence is from in vitro studies.
population_specificity: Not specified (focused on terpenoid compounds in Rhizoma Curcumae).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify new pharmacological treatments for vaginitis by reviewing the phytotherapeutic effects of essential oils and herbal compounds.
results_summary: The study found that essential oils like carvacrol, geraniol, and tea tree oil exhibited anti-candida, anti-bacterial, and anti-trichomonas properties, with some compounds showing comparable efficacy to metronidazole. The results suggest potential for standardized herbal treatments in vaginitis.
population_specificity: Human, animal, and in vitro studies were included (no specific population detailed).
effective_dosage: Not specified (only mentions "very low concentration" for geranium oil and geraniol).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the MMP inhibition characteristics and antibacterial activity of essential oils from Salvia fruticosa, Myrtus communis, Juniperus communis, and Lavandula stoechas, particularly focusing on their potential as therapeutic agents.
results_summary: The study found that all tested essential oils inhibited MMP-2 at concentrations of 1 and 5 µL/mL, with M. communis and L. stoechas also inhibiting MMP-9. The oils showed limited antibacterial effects but were not cytotoxic to keratinocytes at MMP-inhibiting concentrations.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study on periodontopathogens and keratinocytes).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the anti-inflammatory effects of an essential oils (EO) rinse against HM-302, CPC, and a water-only control in preventing gingival inflammation.
results_summary: The EO rinse was less effective than HM-302 in preventing gingival inflammation, as HM-302 showed significantly better results in reducing gingival index scores. No serious adverse effects were reported for any treatment group.
population_specificity: 62 patients in a double-blinded, randomized controlled trial.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antibacterial activity of nine essential oils against *Streptococcus mutans* in vitro and compare their effectiveness.
results_summary: Cinnamon oil showed the highest antibacterial activity against *S. mutans*, followed by lemongrass and cedarwood oils. Wintergreen, lime, peppermint, and spearmint oils showed no antibacterial activity.
population_specificity: *Streptococcus mutans* (in vitro study, no human subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the chemical components and anti-infective activities of Artemisia essential oils based on literature from 2000-2011.
results_summary: The study highlights the broad bioactivity of essential oils from Artemisia species, including anti-malarial, anti-inflammatory, and antimicrobial effects, supported by identified chemical compounds. The review consolidates evidence of their traditional and modern medicinal uses.
population_specificity: Not specified (literature review of existing studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically review pre-clinical and clinical trial evidence on the benefits and safety of aromatherapy for cancer patients.
results_summary: The study found short-term improvements in general well-being, anxiety, depression, and pain control, lasting up to 8 weeks after treatment, but no long-lasting effects. Adverse effects were minimal but included skin irritation, allergic reactions, phototoxicity, and reversible prepubertal gynecomastia with repeated topical use of lavender and tea tree oil.
population_specificity: Cancer patients
study_duration: Effects observed up to 8 weeks post-treatment

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of a blended essential oil (lavender and bergamot) on autonomic parameters and emotional responses in humans to assess its potential for treating depression or anxiety.
results_summary: The blended essential oil significantly reduced pulse rate, blood pressure, and subjective behavioral arousal, with participants reporting feeling more calm and relaxed compared to the control group.
population_specificity: 40 healthy volunteers

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of blended essential oils (lavender, clary sage, marjoram) on menstrual cramps in outpatients with primary dysmenorrhea and identify key analgesic components.
results_summary: The study found that aromatic oil massage significantly reduced pain intensity and duration in the essential oil group, with four key analgesic components (linalyl acetate, linalool, eucalyptol, β-caryophyllene) comprising 79.29% of the blend. Both groups showed significant pain reduction, but the essential oil group had a greater reduction in pain duration.
population_specificity: Outpatients diagnosed with primary dysmenorrhea and experiencing moderate to severe pain (numeric rating scale >5).
effective_dosage: 3% concentration of blended essential oils in unscented cream, applied daily.
study_duration: From the end of the last menstruation to the beginning of the next menstruation (approximately one menstrual cycle).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety, chemical composition, and potential therapeutic effects (anti-inflammatory, hepatoprotective, antihyperglycemic) of Artemisia dracunculus L. essential oils, focusing on differences between Russian and French cultivars.
results_summary: The study found that essential oils from tarragon exhibit potential anti-inflammatory, hepatoprotective, and antihyperglycemic effects in rodent models, with no reported acute toxicity or mutagenic activity at human-relevant doses despite concerns about estragole and methyleugenol. Water extracts were noted to pose minimal risk due to low levels of these compounds.
population_specificity: Rodents (mainly from Russian sources)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the clinical efficacy of essential oils (EOs) versus chlorhexidine (CHX) and distilled water as cooling liquids for subgingival ultrasonic mechanical instrumentation (UMI) in treating furcation involvements (FI).
results_summary: The study found that EOs, CHX, and distilled water all significantly improved periodontal health metrics (PI, GI, PD, BOP, PGM, CAL, HAL) at 1 and 3 months. EOs showed a significant reduction in BOP scores compared to CHX and water, but no other significant differences were observed among the groups.
population_specificity: 45 patients with Class II furcation involvements (244 FI sites).
effective_dosage: Not specified (irrigation with EOs as a cooling liquid).
study_duration: Single treatment session, with follow-up at 1 and 3 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antibacterial properties of essential oils (EOs) and their potential as novel antimicrobial compounds, particularly against Staphylococcus aureus and other bacteria.
results_summary: The study found that certain EOs, such as carvacrol and perilla oil, exhibit inhibitory effects against Staphylococcus aureus and suppress toxin expression, while geraniol modulates drug resistance in gram-negative species. EOs also show promise as biopreservatives in food products and for topical administration, though clinical data on oral use is limited.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro or general bacterial studies implied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of an essential oil-containing mouthrinse versus a 0.07% CPC-containing mouthrinse in inhibiting gingivitis and plaque development in a 2-week experimental gingivitis model.
results_summary: The essential oil mouthrinse was superior to the CPC rinse in reducing gingivitis (9.4% reduction) and plaque (6.6% reduction), with both rinses outperforming the negative control. The study concluded that essential oils had superior antiplaque/antigingivitis effectiveness compared to CPC.
population_specificity: Subjects in a 2-week experimental gingivitis model (147 randomized, 142 completed).
effective_dosage: Twice daily rinsing with assigned mouthrinse.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the chemical composition and pharmacological effects of the genus Bupleurum, including essential oils, and explore their biological activities.
results_summary: The study identified essential oils as one of the secondary metabolites in Bupleurum with relevant biological activity, though the primary focus was on triterpene saponins, lignans, and polysaccharides. No specific efficacy data for essential oils were highlighted, but they were noted as part of the plant's bioactive components.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing studies on Bupleurum species).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of various treatments for head lice, including herbal and essential oils.
results_summary: The study included essential oils among the interventions reviewed but did not provide specific details on their effectiveness or safety compared to other treatments. The overall quality of evidence was assessed using GRADE, but essential oil-specific results were not highlighted.
population_specificity: School children, particularly those with more siblings, longer hair, and from lower socioeconomic groups.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of essential oils as an antimicrobial additive in animal feed to reduce pathogen carriage.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that essential oils may have greater potential than microencapsulated organic acids or bacteriophage in reducing pathogen carriage in animals, though results are preliminary and context-dependent.
population_specificity: Animals in production systems (specific species not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of plant-derived natural resins, including essential oils, as antimicrobial agents against drug-resistant strains.
results_summary: The study discussed the antifungal, antibacterial, and antiprotozoal activity of natural gums, resin extracts, essential oils, and isolated compounds, suggesting their potential as antimicrobial agents. However, specific efficacy data for essential oils were not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing literature).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the molecular interactions between monoterpenes and phenylpropenes (components of essential oils) with voltage-gated ion channels in various biological contexts.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that essential oils, particularly their terpene constituents, show potential as bioactive compounds targeting voltage-gated ion channels, which could be relevant for drug development. However, it does not provide specific clinical outcomes or efficacy data.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of molecular interactions, not a clinical study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical efficacy of subgingival ultrasonic instrumentation irrigated with essential oils (EOs) for treating residual periodontal pockets in individuals with chronic periodontitis.
results_summary: The study found significant reductions in probing pocket depth (PPD) and bleeding on probing (BOP), as well as clinical attachment level (CAL) gain in both test and control groups. However, only initially deep pockets (PPD ≥7 mm) showed significantly greater CAL gain and PPD reduction in the essential oils group compared to the control.
population_specificity: Sixty-four individuals with chronic periodontitis and residual pockets (pocket depth ≥5 mm).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of lavender essential oil on episiotomy wound healing compared to povidone-iodine.
results_summary: Lavender oil showed no significant difference in pain relief compared to povidone-iodine but significantly reduced redness at the incision site. The study suggests lavender oil as a viable alternative for episiotomy wound care.
population_specificity: 120 primiparous women with singleton pregnancies, no acute/chronic diseases or allergies, who underwent normal vaginal delivery and episiotomy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the antimicrobial effectiveness of thymol, carvacrol, and thyme oil against Salmonella on grape tomatoes.
results_summary: Thymol (0.4 mg/ml) was the most effective, achieving >4.1-log reductions of Salmonella after a 5-min wash and >4.3-log reductions after 10 min. The antimicrobial agents did not affect the tomatoes' phenolic content, ascorbic acid, color, pH, taste, aroma, or visual quality.
population_specificity: Grape tomatoes inoculated with Salmonella.
effective_dosage: Thymol (0.2 and 0.4 mg/ml), thyme oil (1 and 2 mg/ml), carvacrol (0.2 and 0.4 mg/ml).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review recent developments in the biosynthesis and medicinal properties of lavender essential oils.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that lavender essential oils contain therapeutic compounds like linalool and linalyl acetate, influenced by plant genetics and environment, and notes growing interest in their use in alternative medicine and aromatherapy.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of lavender essential oils)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the literature on the therapeutic use of essential oils in women's health, particularly in labor and delivery settings.
results_summary: The study found that essential oils are accepted by women and have not been shown to cause harm, though research often combines aromatherapy with other therapies and uses small samples. Aromatherapy mixtures are deemed appropriate for use in labor and delivery settings.
population_specificity: Women in labor and delivery settings.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the insecticidal activity of 25 essential oils against permethrin-resistant head lice to identify viable alternatives to synthetic insecticides.
results_summary: The study found significant differences in fumigant activity among the essential oils, with Cinnamomum porphyrium, Aloysia citriodora (chemotype 2), and Myrcianthes pseudomato being the most effective. These oils showed potential for incorporation into pediculicide formulations after further testing.
population_specificity: Permethrin-resistant head lice (Pediculus humanus capitis).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to test the effectiveness of topically applied pure lavender oil in reducing challenging behaviors in nursing home residents with dementia.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide results, as the study appears to be in the design phase. The outcomes will determine if lavender oil reduces behavioral issues compared to placebo.
population_specificity: Nursing home residents with moderate to severe dementia and associated behavioral problems.
effective_dosage: 1 ml of 30% high-strength lavender oil applied topically on three days per week.
study_duration: Two weeks (one week per condition with a cross-over design).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the antiplaque/antigingivitis effectiveness of an essential oils mouthrinse versus a 0.05% cetylpyridinium chloride mouthrinse.
results_summary: The essential oils mouthrinse showed statistically significant reductions in plaque and gingivitis compared to both the cetylpyridinium chloride mouthrinse (32.4% and 56.2% reductions, respectively) and the control group (36.3% and 69.7% reductions, respectively). The cetylpyridinium chloride mouthrinse also outperformed the control but to a lesser extent.
population_specificity: Generally healthy subjects with mild to moderate plaque and gingivitis.
effective_dosage: Twice daily use (specific concentration not detailed in abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the chemical profile and photo-induced cytotoxic activity of essential oils from two endemic Calabrian Citrus species against melanoma cell lines.
results_summary: The essential oils of C. bergamia and C. medica cv. Diamante showed selective cytotoxic activity against the A375 melanoma cell line, with IC50 values of 79.3 and 89.1 µg/mL, respectively, after UV irradiation. Bergapten demonstrated strong antiproliferative activity (IC50 71.3 µg/mL), while citropten did not show similar effects.
population_specificity: Melanoma cell lines (amelanotic melanoma C32 and malignant melanoma A375).
effective_dosage: IC50 values of 79.3 µg/mL (C. bergamia), 89.1 µg/mL (C. medica cv. Diamante), and 71.3 µg/mL (bergapten).
study_duration: 100 min exposure for essential oils, 20 min for bergapten.
